lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court said the Obama administration must allow the sale of “fixed indemnity” insurance, generally a less comprehensive policy.

headline.print_headline: Court Strikes Down Obama Health Care Rule Backing Insurance Standards
headline.main: Court Strikes Down Obama Health Care Rule on Insurance Standards

snippet: A federal appeals court said the Obama administration must allow the sale of “fixed indemnity” insurance, generally a less comprehensive policy....
abstract: Federal appeals court rules that Obama administration must allow stand-alone sale of so-called fixed indemnity insurance, which is normally less comprehensive and less expensive than insurance required by Affordable Care Act; decision strikes down existing rule that barred sale of such insurance except as supplement to major medical coverage.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
